quest.name: Disarmed
journal: Slowfix looks more agitated than you have ever seen him.

A panicked Slowfix informs you of the presence of a new primal─a colossus of steam and steel that has risen from the waters of the Thaliak. Soon after, Y'shtola arrives bearing still more sobering news: though the machine was active for but a moment, her measurements indicate that it is drawing aether from the hinterlands at a rate that will render the entire area lifeless within the space of a few moons. While she seeks Matoya's counsel on how the metal giant might be denied access to this aether, she bids you keep watch over it alongside Cid. Seek him out at Bigwest Shortstop.

Cid tells you that the Illuminati─the secretive fraternity of goblin scholars─were responsible for summoning the primal. Given the mechanical nature of the giant, he believes your best hope lies in seeking out and destroying whatever passes for its engine. Whilst Cid questions Brayflox about the Illuminati, he bids you join Biggs in the Makers' Quarter and aid him in finding a way inside the colossus.

It would seem that Biggs and Wedge have discovered a hatch in the colossus's hand which is not protected by the barrier. Unfortunately, it is locked by some unknown mechanism. All is not lost, however, as Wedge has intercepted a coded Illuminati communication on his linkpearl, and believes that deciphering the strange message may hold the key to entering the giant. Redbrix, the goblin watchman, tells you Roundrox may have the type of crystal the Illuminati use to encode their communications. Make your way to Bigwest Shortstop, and sprinkle 3G7-001B on Roundrox's pile of treasure to find out for sure.
You sprinkle the 3G7-001B over the pile of trinkets, and notice something glimmering near the top. Hopefully, Roundrox won't mind you borrowing it...

Somewhat predictably, Roundrox does mind you taking her things without permission, and demands that you explain yourself. It would seem that you chose her most prized possession, and she allows you to take it only after you swear to return it. Deliver it─and Roundrox's warning─to Wedge.

Using Roundrox's glowstone and an Ironworks decoder, Wedge reveals that the Illuminati are sending out...gibberish. Luck appears to be on your side, however, as a treasure hunter by the name of Mide appears soon after, and offers you her aid. Thanks to her, Biggs succeeds in opening the hatch just as Cid arrives. Though he was able to glean little of use from Brayflox concerning the primal or the Illuminati, he speculates that the metal giant is akin to an exceedingly large mammet─meaning that you need only locate and destroy its core to end the threat it poses. Gird your loins for whatever awaits you within the colossal machine, and set about exploring its interior.

※The Fist of the Father can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
You have successfully explored the colossus's hand. Make your way back outside.

As you make your way out of the hand of the colossus with Mide and Roundrox, you find your path blocked by a host of goblins. At their head stands Quickthinx Allthoughts, Grand Master of the Illuminati. He informs Mide that the thing she seeks lies elsewhere, prompting a laughing machinist at his side to mention something called the “Alexander Initiative.” Before Quickthinx can censure his loose-lipped underling, Mide opens fire, causing the bombs on the goblins' backs to detonate, and enabling you to make your escape. Now safely out of harm's way, speak with Biggs at Bigwest Shortstop, and tell him of all that has occurred.
Biggs is intrigued by this Alexander Initiative, and wonders aloud if the primal itself is named Alexander. Whether it be so or no, one thing is clear: much of the machine remains to be explored.
objectives: Speak with Backrix at Bigwest Shortstop.
Speak with Biggs in the Makers' Quarter.
Use the pinch of 3G7-001B on Roundrox's junk pile at Bigwest Shortstop.
Deliver the glowstone to Wedge in the Makers' Quarter.
Enter the Fist of the Father.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Is uplander seeing it? Giant of iron, rising from river?

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Y'shtola and Cid leave to learn more, but are not back yet! Great is plight of gobbieflock! Giant is too big, can squash Idyllshire flat! Where are uplanders!?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Y'shtola-)Calm yourself, Slowfix.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. 'Tis well you are here, for our need is dire.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A colossus of steam and steel has risen from the Thaliak.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Yet it is no mere forgotten contrivance of Sharlayan. The resultant aetheric disturbance confirms that it is a primal, and that it was summoned amidst the ruins left for the river to reclaim.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: For a mercy, it stopped dead no sooner than it had broken the water's surface. But so long as it remains in our realm, it may spring to life again at any moment.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, but what does uplander find near Idyllshire? Is wilderness still heavy with aether?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Nay, the aether grows perilously thin, and more swiftly than I could have imagined.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The primal is bleeding the land dry. Should it be suffered to continue, this entire region will become a barren waste in a matter of moons.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: N-No! Gobbieflock has only just found home after long wanderings! Idyllshire will not fall─Slowfix will not allow it!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And nor will we. I have already spoken with Alphinaud, and he concurs that we Scions of the Seventh Dawn must do all in our power to eliminate the threat. Yet given its size, I deem it wise to attack from two fronts.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Our first and most obvious recourse is to keep our foe in check with blade and magic, much as we have done with other such adversaries. Second, I propose that we attempt to cut off the flow of aether which sustains it, mayhap by physically separating the primal from the land.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If we are to be rid of the colossus, I think the latter course more promising, and mean to enlist Master Matoya's aid in pursuing it. Yet such things take time.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thus, I have asked Master Garlond to remain here and keep watch over our foe. Given its apparently mechanical nature, his expertise should prove invaluable to you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “To you,” I say, for I would leave the fate of Idyllshire in your hands. Should the primal chance to stir ere my return, you are to join Cid in repelling it. An unenviable task, but one for which you are singularly qualified.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Rest assured, I do not mean to linger with Master Matoya any longer than necessary. The moment we find a solution, I shall make haste to rejoin you here. Well then, let us be about our duties. I will leave you to discuss strategies with Cid.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Backrix is keeper of knowings for Idyllshire, can say where Cid has gone. Uplander should start with Backrix.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Backrix stays at Bigwest Shortstop, keeps eyes on doings of Illuminati.

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text:
Pssshkoh... Shiny junk and sparkly rocks,♪
Bittybobs and whirlycogs.♪

dialogue.name: BACKRIX
dialogue.text: Backrix is keeper of knowings and data! What does uplander wish to learn about? Ah, uplander comes in search of Cid, yes?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: My thanks for sharing your knowings, Backrix. These Illuminati are indeed most hostile.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename old friend! You haven't seen Y'shtola, have you?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...Drained of all aether in a matter of mere moons? Seven hells! How much power does that thing need? Too much, plainly. Well, it sounds as if we have an urgent dismantling job on our hands.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: From what Backrix has been telling me, the Illuminati are the most likely culprits. They have the knowledge to summon a primal, and the requisite shortsightedness not to think better of it.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: “Fanatical” captures their philosophy nicely, I think─their goal being nothing less than sole ownership of all the world's technology. Needless to say, they're more than willing to kill anyone who stands between them and what they want.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Quite how they managed to coax a primal into the hulk of a Sharlayan defense mechanism I don't know, but it looks like they've made themselves a tidy little fortress inside the colossus.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We'll need to contend with them if we're to disable the thing. As for the task itself, simply destroying whatever serves as its engine should do the trick─assuming it is in fact mechanical. ...But before all that, we'll need to find a way in─through yet another bloody barrier.

dialogue.name: BACKRIX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Barrier is not new, rose up three years ago after ground made shiveryshakes. Ruin was freed from riverbed then. Roundrox was there, saw with own two eyes.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Roundrox? Sorry, who is...?

dialogue.name: BACKRIX
dialogue.text: Daughter of Slowfix. Roundrox loves junk more than all other gobbies, was collecting then, and is playing now. Look.

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text:
Pssshkoh... Shiny junk and sparkly rocks,♪
Bittybobs and whirlycogs.♪

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I'm sorry for interrupting, Roundrox, but I need to ask you a question. When the ground shook three years ago, did something come bobbing up to the river's surface?

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: “Bobbing”? Nothing bobbed, silly uplander. Ground made shiveryshakes when giant of whirlycogs stood. And then magic walls came up too!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: So it wasn't the tremor that freed the colossus─it was the colossus which caused the tremor. And you are absolutely certain you saw it rise from the waters, young one?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Seven hells─I think someone tried and failed to summon it three years ago. But was it the Illuminati, or...?

dialogue.name: PSEUDOBRAYFLOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Brayflox comes to trade tongueflaps, uplander.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Ah, just the goblin! Slowfix tells me you're his resident expert on the Illuminati. Pardon me a moment while I consult with my fellow uplander.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Forename─if I may make a suggestion, I'll speak with Brayflox, and learn what I can of our opponents.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: In the meantime, could you investigate the colossus itself? Biggs and Wedge are near where its hand landed on the shore of the Thaliak. Join them, and see if you can't find a way inside the machine. Oh, and good luck with that barrier!

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Here is treasure trove of Roundrox! But shhh─is secret from big gobbies!

dialogue.name: BACKRIX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Backrix makes record of uplanders' lipflaps. Cid says...go to Biggs near river shore.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text:
“Di dah, di dah di di...
Di, dah di di dah...”
What in the blazes...?

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Forename! Come to see the colossus, eh? The chief has us looking for a way in. 'Course, there's a bleedin' barrier around the thing─aye, another one...

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Luckily for us, when the big feller came down, its hand clamped onto the shore here, punching a hole in its defenses, and leaving that round portal there unprotected.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Only trouble is, it's locked and doesn't seem to have a key. For want of a better idea, Wedge is listening in to Illuminati linkpearl communications, in hopes they'll mention the trick to opening it.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: “Di dah, di dah di di...” Hrm. There's only one signal coming from inside the giant, and it's always the same pattern.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: I'm certain it's a code─the Illuminati always use coded messages. From what I hear, they've developed a special kind of crystal specifically for transmuting linkpearl waveforms.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: If we could get our hands on one, the chief's decoding machine here should theoretically be able to use it to untangle the meaning. Quite where we'd find such a crystal is another matter...

dialogue.name: REDBRIX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... Does uplander know Roundrox? She makes great collection of junk and things. Maybe is keeping crystal at Shortstop?

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Wouldn't that be a stroke of luck!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: And it just so happens I've been working on a means of identifying the crystal in question! Here, Forename─take this 3G7-001B!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Sprinkle that powder over this so-called collection, and look for anything that glimmers. It should contain the material we need. You may have to borrow one of Roundrox's treasures, but I'm sure she won't mind if you tell her it's for a good cause.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text:
I designed 3G7-001B precisely for a moment like this! I do hope it works!
...Ah! I almost neglected to mention: if you sprinkle it on something and it starts to smoke─run away. I-I don't expect it will, though! Just, uh...keep that in mind, all right?

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: If you don't find anything, we could always try blowing the hatch open. That armor looks pretty thick, though...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Amongst the jumble of bits and bobs, you spy a faintly glimmering stone.

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Wh-What is uplander doing!? Sneakytaker! Treasure belongs to Roundrox!

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: Uplander needs it? For giant of whirlycogs? But...but glowstone is most favoritest treasure of Roundrox... Mmm... All right. But uplander must promise to bring it back, or Roundrox is getting very angry.

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Be careful with glowstone of Roundrox!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! No burns, I see! ...Hm? Oh, no reason. Tell me, did the 3G7-001B reveal anything?

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Thank you! And you have my word that I'll give this back to Roundrox when I've finished with it. Now, let's take a listen to what the Illuminati are really saying.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Goodness, all that infernal beeping is gone! Now it's a message, clear as day! Let's see...

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: “Today's schedule for Gordias. Registration at seventh bell. Stop. Louse the coeurl cubs at third bell. Stop. Rest and recuperation at second bell. Repeat. Today's schedule for Gordias...”

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Coeurl lousing!? B-But I'm sure that was the only message! This has to be some sort of jest!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Don't be daft, Wedge. It's just another code. You need the proper crystal and the proper knowledge to understand it. <sigh> Bleedin' Illuminati... Should've known it wouldn't be so easy.

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Quite the conundrum you have there...

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: (-???-)But it's your lucky day. I'll crack the code─assuming we can come to a little arrangement.

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: I'm a treasure hunter by trade, and there's a certain something I want inside the giant. I help you get inside, you help me get out with it. A fair deal, no? The name's Mide, by the way.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Uh...charmed, I'm sure. You are aware that the interior is almost certainly swarming with Illuminati, yes?

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Why do you think I came to you? There's strength in numbers, friend. Best we join forces, eh?

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Now, the words you intercepted are largely gibberish. But paired with the numbers─well, you'll see. “Seven, stop, three, stop, two,” wasn't it?

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: You, the big one─see the pipes atop the hatch? There ought to be a valve up there, with a handwheel. Imagine it's a clock, and try turning it right to seven, left to three, and then back to two.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! We did it, we did it!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...So the Illuminati have been announcing the way to enter the colossus all along? Strange. Well done for cracking the code, anyway.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I had less success, sadly. I'm afraid Brayflox knows little more than we do about the Illuminati's plan or the primal.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Come, come, things aren't as bad as all that. We've found a way inside the machine; we'll just have to learn about it as we go.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It's only a massive mammet, after all. Stopping it should be as simple as destroying its core. If we send in a suitably intrepid team of surveyors, I don't see why we can't trace the machine's power back to the source via the struts and piping.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And I know just the womanman to lead the party. What say you, Forename?

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: And what of me, pray tell? I opened the way for this grand expedition of yours─surely that's earned me a place in your little band to hunt for my treasure.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You did as you promised, and you may do as you will now─but only so long as your treasure hunt doesn't endanger the mission.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I'd join you if I could, but there's something I need to see to first. I'll leave Biggs and Wedge here in case of emergencies. Good luck, my friend!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to the Fist of the Father. Gordias can be accessed via the entrance in the Makers' Quarter.

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: You needn't worry unduly about me. Once I have what I'm searching for, I'll leave─simple as that.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: If there's anything we can do to help, you need but ask.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: I'll keep checking Illuminati communications. If there's any change, you'll be the first to know!

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... Uplanders find way into giant of whirlycogs? Oooh, Roundrox finds new treasures aplenty in the─ Er...uh... Nothing!

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Expertly done, adventurer.

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Hm? Well, what have we here?

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... Eheheh... Sorry. Roundrox could not stay away. So many new treasures here!

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Treasures? Oh, you mean the odd bits and bobs. Well, little one, these machina are yours to take. And some of them are rather beautiful, I must admit.

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: <gasp> Uplander can tell pretty machines from ugly!? Just like Roundrox!

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Heh... No harm in adding one more to our company, is there? I'll keep an eye on her.

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Damn it. I was so sure...

dialogue.name: QUICKTHINXALLTHOUGHTS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Pshhhkohhh... Uplanders are unwise to come. But most of all is treasure hunter─what she seeks is not here, not in all of Gordias.

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: As I live and breathe─Quickthinx Allthoughts, master of the Illuminati.

dialogue.name: ILLUMINATIELITEGUARD2090
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Gobbies are backstrapped with boomdust! Uplander shoots, everybody kabooms!

dialogue.name: ILLUMINATIELITEGUARD2090
dialogue.text: Uplander ear-catches tongueflaps of master? Enigma Codex for plansmaking is gone! Illuminati are already undertaking Alexander Initiative!

dialogue.name: QUICKTHINXALLTHOUGHTS
dialogue.text: Pshhhkohhh... FOOLISH GOBBIE! Secrets are kept silent. Tongueflaps never traded with outsiders. Has Quickthinx not ordered so, many times?

dialogue.name: ILLUMINATIELITEGUARD2090
dialogue.text: M-Master, forgive noisemaking of emptyhead! Gobbie did not think! Please, gobbie will take any punishment─just not worst one!

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Now!

dialogue.name: ILLUMINATIELITEGUARD02090
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Wh-What? Uplander is shooting gobbies!?

dialogue.name: ILLUMINATIELITEGUARDB02090
dialogue.text:
And boomdust does not harm uplanders!
Blood! Uplander blood for fallen gobbiekin!

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: I think now would be a good time to leave.

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... Uplander, what is Enigma Codex? Treasure?

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Yes, young one─my treasure.

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: Roundrox has been showing me her treasures─and they're aptly named. Only a fool would call them junk. Just because something has been discarded, it doesn't mean it can't be beautiful.

dialogue.name: MIDE
dialogue.text: She also said that Quickthinx has a face like a machina─cold and calculating. I can only assume she means his mask.

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... Mide is amazing! She can tell pretty junk from ugly almost as well as Roundrox!

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text: This whirlycog Roundrox finds seventy-two yalms north and west. And this one, this one is twenty-four yalms south and east of Arkhitekton!

dialogue.name: ROUNDROX
dialogue.text:
Pshkohhh... Shiny junk and sparkly rocks,♪
Bittybobs and whirlycogs.♪

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename! I'm working with Backrix to intercept Illuminati communications.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: He's got a wonderful memory for details, and a great mind for codes! I must say, the goblins' grasp of technology is something to behold. I'm impressed!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Bleedin' hells! Face-to-face with the head of the Illuminati, eh? Sounds like you had quite an adventure! And this “Alexander Initiative” has got me wondering... Do you reckon it might be the giant's name?

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: No sign of the core though, eh? Well, we'll just have to look further in. I'll let the chief know, anyway.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: He'll be happy to hear Mide and Roundrox are safe, too. Those two haven't stopped talking about machines since they got back. I can't say I've ever thought of junk as pretty, but each to their own.

obj.n: Alexander - The Fist of the Father
